    pygeoogc.exceptions¶

    Customized PyGeoOGC exceptions.

    Module Contents¶

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.ServerError(url: str)¶

    Bases: Exception

    Exception raised when the requested data is not available on the server.

    Parameters

    url (str) – The server url

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.ThreadingException(itr: int, msg: Exception)¶

    Bases: Exception

    Exception raised when the requested data is not available on the server.

    Parameters

    • itr (int) – The number of iteration where the exception occured

    • msg (str) – The exception error message

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.ZeroMatched¶

    Bases: ValueError

    Exception raised when a function argument is missing.

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.InvalidInputValue(inp: str, valid_inputs: Union[List[str], Generator[str, None, None]])¶

    Bases: Exception

    Exception raised for invalid input.

    Parameters

    • inp (str) – Name of the input parameter

    • valid_inputs (tuple) – List of valid inputs

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.InvalidInputType(arg: str, valid_type: str, example: Optional[str] = None)¶

    Bases: Exception

    Exception raised when a function argument type is invalid.

    Parameters

    • arg (str) – Name of the function argument

    • valid_type (str) – The valid type of the argument

    • example (str, optional) – An example of a valid form of the argument, defaults to None.

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

    exception pygeoogc.exceptions.MissingInputs¶

    Bases: ValueError

    Exception raised when there are missing function arguments.

    class args¶
    with_traceback()¶

    Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.
